body.p: IASC believed that such restrictions were unique to employee benefit plans and did not intend to permit this net presentation for other liabilities if the conditions then in IAS 32 and IAS 39 were not met. Accordingly, condition (a) in the new definition refers to the reason for the existence of the fund. IASC believed that an arbitrary restriction of this kind was the only practical way to permit a pragmatic exception to IASC’s general offsetting criteria without permitting an unacceptable extension of this exception to other cases.
